results.title: Backstage at the Kirov
results.brief_description: The splendour of ballet is for so many a world of dreams and miracles. This movie invites us to be part of the passion and dedication blended with the grinding agony of training and rehearsal at the backstage of the famous Kirov Theatre in Leningrad.

results.title: Dance Dans Tanz Danse
results.brief_description: Founded in 1926 by Marie Rambert, Rambert Dance Company is one of dance’s most consistently innovative and imaginative companies. Here are three modern dances by the company featuring music by Bill Withers. The three are: “Lonely Town, Lonely Street” a jazz ballet which conveys a picture of lonely people in a large city; “Intimate Pages” using Janacek’s Second String Quartet; and “Sergeant Early’s Dream” recalling the folklore of the old world with British, Irish and American folk songs. Rated: G

results.title: Harder than Everest
results.brief_description: Of the ten Himalayan expeditions I’ve been on, climbing Mt Gasherbraum IV was the most challenging and spectacular - it was harder than Everest. These are the words of Tim Macartney-Snape, one of a group of seven climbers who actually made it to the summit and shot the entire experience on film at the same time. A spectacular and inspiring video about human achievement.

results.title: Don't be the last to know
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Film Australia and Aviva Ziegler
results.brief_description: Introduced by Mike Willesee - this video provides an in-depth look at two Australian families and their fight against drug addiction. Typical families with day to day problems like everyone else - until a serious drug problem surfaced. Addicts and their families speak frankly about their frustration, confusion and the courage needed to fight back. Essential viewing for all parents.

results.title: Fair play
results.creator_credit: Susan Lambert, Janet Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Australian women cricketers are the undisputed world-cup cricket champions in a sport which is hotly contested by nine affiliated countries. This film follows their latest tour to England to play on the hallowed grounds at Lords.

results.title: The Best of Gillies
results.brief_description: The Gillies Team takes on numerous national treasures (including Bob Hawke, Andrew Peacock, Wran the Man and Don Chipp), and even the odd megabuck personality such as Rupert Murdoch in this new compilation video selected from the hilarious Gillies Report television series. Highlights include Bob Hawke as the Invisible Man; the Maralinga Commission (or Wise After the Event) re-enacted in the form of a cabaret, with Mr Justice McLelland chairing the proceedings in sparkling lurex; and John Clarke - posing as a sports announcer - introduces us to the magnificent game of Farnarkeling. Featuring Max Gillies, John Clarke, Patricia Cooke, Tracey Harvey, Don Watson, Geoff Kelso, Wendy Harmer & Phillip Scott. Rated: PG

results.title: Gertrude Stein and a companion
results.brief_description: This film is a compelling exploration of the 40 year tempestuous relationship between the legendary American writer and lecturer, Gertrude Stein, and her beloved companion, Alice B. Toklas. Based entirely on historical materials and the personal letters of Toklas, it provides an intimate portrait of these two unique and unconventional women. Stein’s thoughts on Alice, the arts, America’s Hemingway and other characters are revealed. Scenes from their public and private lives are interwoven with Alice’s recollections of their time together.

results.title: State of the art. Part 1: History
results.brief_description: Beginning in the frenetic, image-swamped ‘post-modern’ world of today, the film examines the work of four artists who look to the past to make sense of the present and the future.

results.title: Refuse to Dance : The Theatre of Howard Barker
results.creator_credit: Arts Council of Great Britain and Ann Foreman
results.brief_description: This film focuses on the season of Barker’s work produced by the Royal Shakespeare Company at the Barbican in 1985. It juxtaposes extracts from the plays with comments from actors, directors and critics. However, it makes no attempt to pin an evaluation of the work to the personality or biography of the writer.

results.title: Steve Reich : A New Musical Language
results.creator_credit: Margaret Williams and Mary Jane Walsh
results.brief_description: Tonal, repetitive, insistently rhythmic, Reich’s compositions have emerged in the 1980’s as one of the central influences in contemporary music. This film covers Reich’s work over the last twenty years, from the early tape pieces to recent orchestral work, with extracts from concerts filmed in England and New York. Conductor, Michael Tilson Thomas, who has worked closely with Reich, assesses his impact on, and contribution to, contemporary music. Reich himself talks with candour and considerable humour about his life and musical development.
